title: Why Guess? (GES) Could Be a Top Value Stock Pick - Nasdaq.com
text: Value investing is always a very popular strategy, and for good reason. After all, who doesn't want to find stocks that have low PEs, solid outlooks, and decen t dividends  ?  makeArticleAd();  Fortunately for investors looking for this combination, we have identified a strong candidate which may be an impressive value; Guess?, Inc. GES  .   Guess? in Focus    GES may be an interesting play thanks to its forward PE of 13.9, its P/S ratio of 0.5, and its decen t dividend yield  of 2.5%. These factors suggest that Guess? is a pretty good value pick, as investors have to pay a relatively low level for each dollar o f earnings  , and that GES has decent revenue metrics to back up its earnings. Quote   But before you think that Guess? is just a pure value play, it is important to note that it has been seeing solid activity on the earnings estimate front as well. For current year earnings, the consensus has gone up by 3.2% in the past 30 days, thanks to two upward revisions in the past one month compared to none lower.    This estimate strength is actually enough to push GES to a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), suggesting it is poised to outperform. You can see  the complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank stocks   here   .    So really, Guess? is looking great from a number of angles thanks to its PE below 20, a P/S ratio below one, and a strong Zacks Rank, meaning that this company could be a great choice for value investors at this time.
